channel.title: Possible server hijacking?
channel.description: my server just all of a sudden went haywire. I got banned then my other admins did and along with the players. I quick made a new server and the same thing happened. Any idea?[br][size=1]Posted on: September 21, 2007, 07:40:53 PM[/size][hr]i made 3 new servers after that. All saying that my account has been disabled without even being on the server once.

item.title: Possible server hijacking?
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Weird story. My friend got banned, and in the thread he got banned in, someone said something like(note, the kid who said this did THE EXACT SAME THING AS MY FRIEND, AND ISN’T BANNED)
Somethin like…
“PARTY AT YOUR HOUSE WITH WAFFLES!!”

Read full topic

item.title: Possible server hijacking?
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

Waffles!!:

Monkey, I asked why you would build a decompiler(someone said djdecompiler decompiled java files) that just decompiles .java files. I know why you want to decompile .classes -.-

Oh ok Waffles were did u get that name its so original…

Read full topic

item.title: Possible server hijacking?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“Monkey wacko, post:15, topic:145280”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=198992.msg1772019#msg1772019 date=1190449419]
No. djdecompiler reverts class files back to java files. I’ve used it before. Also, as Monkey wacko said, accounts usually have admin accounts that were made when the server was started. But even if you delete it, there may be something in client.java that will automatically make that account an admin when they log on. So the best thing to do would be to either change the password of the account so that noone can guess it, or take the admin crap out of your client.java.
[/quote]

You have no clue what you are talking about! and half of that is what i just said![/quote]
What the hell do you mean I don’t know what I’m talking about? That all makes perfect sense!

And that wasn’t “half” of what you said. I only quoted 1 sentence from you.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Possible server hijacking?
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

xx qwertyuiop xx:

No. djdecompiler reverts class files back to java files. I’ve used it before. Also, as Monkey wacko said, accounts usually have admin accounts that were made when the server was started. But even if you delete it, there may be something in client.java that will automatically make that account an admin when they log on. So the best thing to do would be to either change the password of the account so that noone can guess it, or take the admin crap out of your client.java.

You have no clue what you are talking about! and half of that is what i just said!

Read full topic

item.title: Possible server hijacking?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

No. djdecompiler reverts class files back to java files. I’ve used it before. Also, as Monkey wacko said, accounts usually have admin accounts that were made when the server was started. But even if you delete it, there may be something in client.java that will automatically make that account an admin when they log on. So the best thing to do would be to either change the password of the account so that noone can guess it, or take the admin crap out of your client.java.

Read full topic

item.title: Possible server hijacking?
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

[quote=“Waffles!!, post:12, topic:145280”]What’s the point of decompiling a .java?
Like, really, it’s based in notepad/wordpad >.<[/quote]

Wow, noob when someone compiles something and deletes the java files whats all you have left is the class file right? Now if you want to decompile that class file you download djdecompiler

Read full topic

item.title: Possible server hijacking?
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

Some servers have admin account that have been on there since the server was created some people delete these players but if you do not then most people already know the pass and hop on ur server and destroy it… Also djdecompiler is only for decompiling class files back to java… They could have used a cheat client as well!

Read full topic

item.title: Possible server hijacking?
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Woah woah, don’t delete your .javas. Just download another source, and move those .javas to another folder, so your original server folder has just the .classes, random folders, and .cfgs. See if that fixes it.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Possible server hijacking?
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Pfft, take all the .java’s out of your server so it’s just .class files left XD
Decompiling will slow the ‘hijacker’ down.
